author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: VK Malhotra quits AAI after 40 years
text:
BENGALURU: Vijay Kumar Malhotra has stepped down as the president of the Archery Association of India, ending his links with the national sports federation that lasted for more than 40 years.
The octogenarian is likely to take over as the chief of the All India Council of Sports, an advisory body which is being revived after being asked to down its shutters around 12 years ago. Incidentally, Malhotra had headed the council then.
AAI sources confirmed Malhotra had resigned but said a final decision on it as well as the way forward would be taken once the veteran administrator takes over as AICS chairman. "We haven't received any official communique about Mr Malhotra taking over as AICS chairman. Once that happens, we will seek our members' opinions before charting our course," the sources told TOI.
Malhotra's exit will mean AAI seek recognition from the sports ministry. The body was derecognised in 2012 after Malhotra was re-elected as its president in contravention to the age and tenure guidelines of the sports code. The guidelines prescribe an age cap of 70 and only three consecutive terms of four years each for an NSF's president.
